compilations.description: Winters call for a warm and soothing soup. But, why settle for just one when we’ve curated 25 mouthwatering soup recipes to excite your tastebuds. Start with our crowd-pleasing Hearty Chicken Tortilla Soup and gorge your way through the vegan Healthy and Hearty Black Bean Soup the next day.
compilations.name: 25 Soup Recipes

compilations.description: Who says soups are only for when you're sick? We've got the perfect soup recipes for every occasion. Whip up our flavor-packed Taco Soup for a refreshing punch. Need a delicious soup to start off a fancy dinner party? Test out our favorite, Panera's claim to fame, a cheesy Broccoli Cheddar! The hardest part? Picking out which soup to try. Try 'em out and choose your favorite!
compilations.name: Soups For Every Occasion

compilations.description: We know cooking is not everyone's jam, but lucky for you, we've got a fix for that. Our curated list of classic recipes will always be a hit in your menu & will definitely never fail to impress. If you're just setting foot in the kitchen, you have to test out the Maple Bacon Mashed Potatoes, and for a restaurant-y feel, we've got the Classic Party Guacamole! Test these out and tell us: which one was your favorite?
compilations.name: 7 Classic Recipes Everyone Must Learn To Cook

compilations.description: You're in your 20s and faced with the realities of life. One of those harsh ones? The need to feed. Luckily for you, we've got 30 recipes to master before you're 30: the perfect way to feed yourself. Learn how to make a great glaze for your Pork Chops, how you should cook a Steak In Garlic Butter just to your liking, or something even simpler: a perfect batch of Cookies. The ball's in your court, and so are the delicious eats.
compilations.name: 30 Recipes To Learn Before You Turn 30

results.description: This chicken noodle soup is like a warm hug from the inside out. Loaded with tender chicken, hearty vegetables, and comforting noodles, it's the ultimate comfort food on a chilly day.

instructions.display_text: Heat the olive oil in a large soup pot over medium heat until shimmering. Add the onion, carrots, celery, salt, and pepper. Cook, stirring frequently, until the vegetables are very soft, about 15 minutes.
Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the stock and bring to a boil.

IF MAKING AHEAD: Do not add the noodles or parsley. Cool and store the soup in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 4 days, or in the freezer for up to 2 months. Reheat on the stovetop and add the noodles and parsley just before serving.
Add the noodles and cook for 6 minutes, then add the chicken and cook for about 2 minutes more, until the noodles are tender and the chicken is warmed through.
Season to taste with more salt and pepper, then stir in the parsley.
Serve topped with grated Parmesan.
Enjoy!

results.name: Classic Chicken Noodle Soup

components.raw_text: 4 to 5 cups coarsely shredded chicken (see recipe above)

results.seo_title: Classic Chicken Noodle Soup Recipe - Tasty

results.description: This quick and easy taco soup is made entirely in one pot in less than 30 minutes. Topped with cheese, avocado, and all the fixins, this simple soup makes the perfect weeknight dinner that'll please just about anyone.

instructions.display_text: Add the ground beef and onion to a large pot and stir until the beef is cooked through.
Drain excess liquid.
Add the kidney beans, black beans, corn, tomatoes, tomato sauce, and taco seasoning to the pot, and stir until combined.
Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes.
Serve with cheddar cheese, sour cream, pico de gallo, avocado, corn chips, lime wedges, and cilantro.
Enjoy!

results.name: Taco Soup

compilations.name: Delicious Soups To Keep You Warm This Season

compilations.description: Looking for simple, easy-to-make one-pot dinner recipes? Start with these! You choose from a cheesy mushroom bacon risotto or paprika chicken rice bake depending on what you’re craving. They’re perfect dinner options which will keep you full and fueled for hours. If you're vegetarian or vegan, no problem. You can always swap meat with the vegetable of your choice, or even tofu. Let's eat!
compilations.name: One-Pot Dinners

compilations.description: Winters call for a warm and soothing soup. But, why settle for just one when we’ve curated 25 mouthwatering soup recipes to excite your tastebuds. Start with our crowd-pleasing Hearty Chicken Tortilla Soup and gorge your way through the vegan Healthy and Hearty Black Bean Soup the next day.
compilations.name: 25 Soup Recipes

compilations.description: Looking for simple, easy-to-make meal recipes? Start with these! You can serve them with just about anything, and you can switch up the flavors — like a Filipino-Style One-Pot Chicken Adobo or One-Pot Chicken Teriyaki With Rice — depending on what you’re craving. They’re the perfect meal for a busy day and are ready to eat in no time.
compilations.name: One Pot Recipes For Us Lazy People

compilations.description: Are you a broccoli fan? If so, we've got a bunch of broccoli recipes that're quick, easy, tasty, and are perfect for a special day! Start with a Broccoli Cheddar Soup or try an impressive Broccoli Ham and Cheddar Chicken Roll. Sit down to your favorite movie, pour yourself a drink, and settle in for a stay-at-home movie night that’s the best blend of comfort and culinary deliciousness.
compilations.name: 'Broc' n 'Roll' With These Broccoli Recipes

compilations.description: Who says soups are only for when you're sick? We've got the perfect soup recipes for every occasion. Whip up our flavor-packed Taco Soup for a refreshing punch. Need a delicious soup to start off a fancy dinner party? Test out our favorite, Panera's claim to fame, a cheesy Broccoli Cheddar! The hardest part? Picking out which soup to try. Try 'em out and choose your favorite!
compilations.name: Soups For Every Occasion

compilations.description: We know you miss the Panera Bread experience – we all do! That's why we're bringing Panera Bread to you. Our one-pot broccoli cheddar soup is oh-so-creamy and delicious, and our four-cheese mac and cheese will earn you your own Tik-Tok fame. Craving their salad? Our mixed berry spinach salad with strawberry vinaigrette dressing have got you covered. These recipes are wholesome and hearty, just like the real deal.
compilations.name: Homemade Panera Bread Recipes

compilations.description: Nobody likes doing the dishes, especially after a long day at work. That's why we're bringing you meals that fully come together in just one single pot. If you're looking for a fancy night of indulgence, give our mouthwatering One-Pot Chicken Bacon & Goat Cheese Pasta a try, and if that's not enough, try the spicy One-Pot Chicken Chow Mein! The best part? You can eat things straight out of the pot: we won't tell.
compilations.name: One-Pot Recipes For Those Who Hate Doing Dishes

compilations.description: We LOVE cheese (who doesn't?) and we know you do too, so we've rounded up some recipes that'll celebrate that cheese adoration. Use your Hot Cheetos and make yourself a delicious Hot Cheeto Burrito, oozing with cheese. Stuff the cheese in some mashed potatoes, fry it, and watch the lovely pull you'll get, or go the classic route and add a lot of it to your mac and cheese. The possibilities are endless and dang, are they cheesi-licious.
compilations.name: Cheesy Recipes You Just Need

compilations.description: If you're a vegetarian that wants to eat gourmet, well, now you can – no compromises. We bring to you, the fanciest, most delicious vegetarian gourmet recipes! Try a layered beauty like the Mushroom Wellington and — if that's not enough — try out our green and gorgeous Cauliflower Gnocchi. You know what time it is? It is time to 'make it fancy!'
compilations.name: Gourmet Recipes That Are Vegetarian

compilations.description: Looking for soup recipes to warm you up on a cold night? Try a classic like our vegetable dumpling soup that will instantly take you back to your childhood, or soothe your soul with our warm tomato basil soup. Get under your cozy blanket and slurp your heart out!
compilations.name: Soup Recipes That Will Immediately Make You Feel Better

compilations.description: Broccoli's having its moment — and we're here for it. Choose from an array of broccoli-laden goodies, from our broccoli cheddar soup to some melt-in-your-mouth beef and broccoli-stuffed rice triangles. These recipes are super easy to make, delicious at any hour of the day and perfect for your next game night.
compilations.name: Broccoli Recipes That Taste Bomb

compilations.description: You don't have to be a master chef to make amazing meals with cheese. Cheese is an ingredient that few people can resist; it's simple but always adds that extra something special! Why not make some delicious Cheesy Chicken Balls , or try our famous One-Pot Broccoli Cheddar Soup ? After all, everything is better with cheese!
compilations.name: Everything Is Better With Cheese!

compilations.description: Broccoli is one of the most versatile vegetables out there. And we’re here to show you all it can do in these mouthwatering recipes. Try our oh-so-comforting Creamy Broccoli Soup, lip-smacking Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry, or satisfying Cheesy Chicken Broccoli Bake!
compilations.name: 5 Recipes That Will Make You Love Broccoli

results.description: This easy and comforting soup is made in one pot with fresh broccoli, sharp cheddar cheese, and a handful of simple ingredients for a delicious and hearty meal.

instructions.display_text: Trim the stems off of the broccoli heads, then chop into small florets.

Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the flour and stir until the mixture lightly browns, 2–3 minutes. Pour in the half-and-half and cook, stirring constantly, until simmering. Reduce the heat to low and add the vegetable stock. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5–10 minutes, until thickened.
Mix in the broccoli, carrots, salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Simmer for 10–15 minutes, until the vegetables are tender. Add the cheese and stir until it melts and combines with the other ingredients.
Ladle the soup into bowls and serve warm.
Enjoy!

results.name: One-Pot Broccoli Cheddar Soup

tips_summary.content:
• Reduce the amount of salt for a less salty soup 🧂
• Mix the cream and broth together for a smoother texture 🥛
• Add more cheese for a bolder flavor 🧀
• Use less cheese to avoid a grainy texture 🧀
• Add garlic for an extra kick of flavor 🧄

compilations.description: Fall is officially here: between all the pumpkin spice and apple cider, autumn is all about seasonal comforts. We've got the perfect line-up to keep you warm and cozy. Sip on pumpkin spiced coffee while you cook this feel-good chicken pot pie. And celebrate the weekend with the best apple pie! These recipes will give fall comfort food a whole new meaning.
compilations.name: Cozy Recipes For Fall Season

compilations.description: Whether you're a busy home cook, a lazy one, or a chef-in-training, your slow cooker is a total gift. Use it to make easy soups and stews like butternut squash soup and turkey chili. Or task it with all your basic recipes from mashed potatoes to pot roast. Or you can get sophisticated and whip up a Thai-inspired green curry. The options are endless!
compilations.name: 30 Days 30 Slow Cooker Recipes

compilations.description: What is soup if not a medium of healthy rest for your soul! Make yourself some warm Chicken Pot Pie Soup. This creamy Bacon Sweet Potato Soup will definitely feel like a cozy hug. These recipes will surely make you feel good inside and out!
compilations.name: 5 Delicious Soup Recipes!

compilations.description: There’s lots of room for disagreement on food, but there aren’t many vegetables that are as well-loved as the potato! Bake it, fry it, dice it, slice it, mash it, the options are endless! Here are a few recipes you can try with potatoes! Our tornado potato has a real twist to it and our potato lasagna is one of the best you have ever tasted. Try it now!
compilations.name: Can’t Say No To Potatoes!
Kid-Friendly Weeknight Dinners That Won't Break The Bank

results.description: This creamy and decadent soup is perfect for a cold winter night. Loaded with bacon, cheese, and potatoes, it's like a hug in a bowl.

instructions.display_text: Add the potatoes, onions, chicken broth, salt and pepper to the slow cooker.
Set it to low for 6 hours or high for 4 hours.
In a saucepan, combine the butter, flour, heavy cream and sour cream. Whisk until thickened.
When the slow cooker is done, pour in the thickened mix. Stir, cover and set the slow cooker to low for another 30 minutes.
Serve with shredded cheese, bacon and chopped scallions.
Enjoy!

results.name: Slow Cooker Loaded Potato Soup

components.raw_text: 4 cups of potatoes, peeled and chopped

A comforting bowl of potato leek soup or a quick and easy cajun shrimp bake are great for a weeknight. If you're looking to impress, the cheesy French onion chicken is your best bet. It's thyme you get cooking!

compilations.description: Budgeting can be really hard, but you know what's easy? Making these supremely tasty, wallet-friendly meals! Test out the best-in-town Chili Cheese Dog Boats. Chase those right down with a soul-soothing Potato Leek Soup that'll warm you up from head to toe. Eating deliciously doesn't have to be expensive or time-consuming. So, ready to get cooking?

results.description: Buttery, creamy, and made oh-so fragrant with the help of thyme and chives, this potato leek soup is the perfect companion to any cold weather dinner. Serve with a bit of hot sauce for an extra kick and a sprinkling of croutons for added crunch.

instructions.display_text: Melt butter on medium heat in a large pot. Add the chopped leeks and stir until coated with butter.
Cover the pot and lower heat, cook for around 10 minutes until the leeks have softened.
Increase to medium-high. Add garlic, potatoes, salt, and pepper. Cook for 1 minute, then add vegetable broth, water, thyme, and bay leaf. Bring to a boil.
Lower heat and cover pot with a lid and simmer for 15 minutes, or until potatoes are tender and easily speared by a fork.
Uncover and remove thyme and bay leaf.
Use an immersion or countertop blender to blend the soup until smooth.
Stir in chives and hot sauce (optional).
Allow to cool 2 minutes and serve.
Enjoy!

results.name: Potato Leek Soup

compilations.description: Winters call for a warm and soothing soup. But, why settle for just one when we’ve curated 25 mouthwatering soup recipes to excite your tastebuds. compilations.description: It's hard to find a fault in the humble potato: it's simple, savory, sweet when needed, and always satisfying. From a spirally tornado potato to some hearty baked potato soup, these potato-filled recipes are sure to fill your carb-deprived tummy. What are you waiting for? Let's potate.
compilations.name: 21 Days 21 Potato Recipes

compilations.description: Looking for soup recipes to warm you up on a cold night? Try a classic like our vegetable dumpling soup that will instantly take you back to your childhood, or soothe your soul with our warm tomato basil soup. Get under your cozy blanket and slurp your heart out!
compilations.name: Soup Recipes That Will Immediately Make You Feel Better

results.description: This loaded baked potato soup is the ultimate comfort food that will warm you up on a cold day. This creamy soup is topped with crispy bacon, shredded cheese, and fresh chives for a unique twist on a regular baked potato.

instructions.display_text: Preheat your oven to 425˚F (220˚C).
On a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, rub potatoes with salt, pepper, and olive oil.
Bake in preheated oven for 40-50 minutes.
Once cooled, peel and mash potatoes, and set aside.
Heat oil in large pot over a medium-high heat.
Add onion and garlic. Cook until translucent and garlic is fragant, about 5 minutes.
Add butter and melt.
Bring in flour and stir until mixture is lightly browned.
Add in the chicken broth and cream cheese. Stir until fully incorporated
Add in the mashed potatoes and combine.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish bowl with shredded cheese, bacon, and chives.
Enjoy!

results.description: If there’s one thing you should be eating more of this fall, it’s butternut squash soup (the homemade kind, of course). This seasonal recipe is easy to whip together in no time, and you can make a big batch at once to freeze for lazy nights or on-the-go work lunches.

instructions.display_text: Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat, then add the garlic and onion and sauté for 1-2 minutes, until the onion is translucent.
Add the potato, celery, carrot, salt, and pepper. Sauté for 3 minutes.
Add the butternut squash, broth, water, bay leaf, and thyme and stir. Bring to a boil.
Cover and reduce the heat to low. Simmer for 25-30 minutes.
Remove the thyme stems and bay leaf.
Use an immersion or countertop blender to blend the soup until smooth.
Let cool for 2 minutes, then serve.
Enjoy!

results.name: Butternut Squash Soup

components.raw_text: 2 pounds of butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed

For a delicious weeknight recipe, whip up some garlic parmesan stuffed mushroom paired with a one-pot chicken mushroom pasta. Or, simply whip up some comforting cream of mushroom soup! Or get a taste of Japan with this Japanese arancini. The options are endless!

compilations.description: There are some recipes any cook should have in their arsenal, whether you're a beginner or a seasoned professional. These recipes are easy to follow and easy to master, so get ready to impress your friends, family, and everyone one you meet! From Fudgy Brownies to Chinese Chicken Fried Rice , you'll have these dishes down by heart in no time!
compilations.name: Recipes You Should Know By Now

compilations.description: Now that wintertime is here and the weather is getting colder everyday, it's time to snuggle up under your blanket, light up some scented candles, put on your favorite Netflix show, and enjoy a warm, comforting bowl of soup! Ah, it just sounds so relaxing! A nice, warm bowl of good soup (thanks, Adam Driver) can really brighten anyone's mood! Try our creamy Tomato Soup with Grilled Cheese Croutons, or our hearty Cream of Mushroom Soup! Indulge in our top soup recipes to make this winter the coziest one yet!
compilations.name: Soups For The Soul

results.description: Smacking with savory flavor, and creamy in texture, this soup will have you wishing for an endless winter. It’s essentially composed of mushrooms, heavy cream, flour, and a few vegetables, meaning anyone can make it on short notice and with a tight budget. Serve with a crusty bread, and top with fresh parsley as desired.

instructions.display_text: In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, melt the butter, then add the onion and saute until translucent, 3 minutes. Add the garlic and stir, then cook for 1 more minute.
Add the mushrooms, salt, and pepper and cook until they begin to turn golden brown, about 5 minutes.
Add the flour and stir to coat the mushrooms, until combined.
Add the white wine, stir, and cook until combined, about 1 minute.
Add the vegetable stock, stir, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add the heavy cream and stir to combine.
Blend soup to your desired consistency with an immersion blender or standing blender.
Serve hot, garnished with parsley.
Enjoy!

results.name: Cream Of Mushroom Soup

compilations.description: We all have those lazy days where we just don't want to put in too much effort. Here's to those no-fuss days and these one-pot dishes that will make cooking a whole lot easier. Try out the fancy shrimp and spinach pasta and eat your way through the chicken chow mein. No more cooking for hours, no more piles of dirty dishes and what a space-saver in the fridge!
compilations.name: One Pot Recipes

compilations.description: Tired of washing all the dishes after every meal? We know the feeling, and we've got your back. That's why we're bringing you the best of the kitchen sink, made magical by just a single pot! Test out our Turkey Chili with Cornbread Dumplings for a homely, comforting touch to your dish and pair it with our cozy Ham & Potato Soup. And don't worry, there's more where those came from. In fact, we bet you can't pick your favorites!
compilations.name: One Pot Meals You Must Try

results.description: Cozy up with a bowl of this delicious one-pot ham and potato soup. Loaded with chunks of ham, tender potatoes, and flavorful herbs, it's the ultimate comfort food.

instructions.display_text: In a 6-quart (5.7 liters) dutch oven, cook bacon over medium-high heat until fat is rendered out and the pieces begin to get crispy.
Add onion, carrot, and celery, and cook until just tender, about 3 minutes.
Reduce heat to medium and add flour, stirring constantly for 1-2 minutes to avoid lumps.
Add ham, potatoes, thyme, and black pepper. Stir to coat the meat and potatoes in the roux/vegetable mix.
Add the chicken broth and bay leaves.
Cover and bring to a boil. Then reduce heat to medium-low and cook covered for 25-30 minutes.
Remove bay leaves and stir in cream. Return to a simmer and serve.
Enjoy!

results.keywords: , christmas, cream, creamy, ham, hearty, one-pot, potato, soup, thyme, winter
results.name: One-Pot Ham & Potato Soup

components.raw_text: 2 strips of bacon, cut into 1-inch pieces

results.seo_title: One-Pot Ham & Potato Soup Recipe - Tasty
